content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DSTERM
      operator: contains
      value: INFORMED CONSENT
    - name: RFICDTC
      operator: date_not_equal_to
      value: $min_ds_dsstdtc
    - name: DSTERM
      operator: contains
      value: OBTAINED
Operations:
  - operator: min_date
    domain: DS
    name: DSSTDTC
    id: $min_ds_dsstdtc
    group:
      - USUBJID
Match Datasets:
  - Name: DM
    Keys:
      - USUBJID
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0143
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: DM.RFICDTC must equal the earliest DS.DSSTDTC when DSTERM indicates informed
  consent obtained.
Outcome:
  Message: DM.RFICDTC is not equal to the earliest DSSTDTC, when DSTERM indicates
    Informed consent obtained.
  Output Variables:
    - DSDECOD
    - RFICDTC
    - DSSTDTC
    - $min_ds_dsstdtc
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0143
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: This will be the same as the date of informed consent
                  in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented.  Would
                  be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: Specification
                Section: '5.2'
              - Cited Guidance: "RFICDTC should correspond to the date of the informed\
                  \ consent protocol milestone in DS, if that protocol milestone is\
                  \ documented in DS.\n In the event that there are multiple informed\
                  \ consents, this will be the date of the first one."
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 10c
                Section: '5.2'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DS

json.Description: DM.RFICDTC must equal the earliest DS.DSSTDTC when DSTERM indicates informed consent obtained.

Outcome.Message: DM.RFICDTC is not equal to the earliest DSSTDTC, when DSTERM indicates Informed consent obtained.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented.  Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.

RFICDTC should correspond to the date of the informed consent protocol milestone in DS, if that protocol milestone is documented in DS.
 In the event that there are multiple informed consents, this will be the date of the first one.
